intro: Amsinckia hispidula, commonly known as the hairy paloverde, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, and its leaves are small, hairy, and often deciduous. Amsinckia hispidula has a deep root system that allows it to thrive in poor soils and withstand drought conditions. It is also valued for its ability to provide habitat and food for desert wildlife.
